H0.text: Less than 1 second is the time it takes light from the nearest star other than the Sun to reach Earth.

H1.text: About 1 hour is the time it takes light from the nearest star other than the Sun to reach Earth.

H2.text: About 1 month is how long it takes light from the nearest star other than the Sun to reach Earth.

H3.text: About 4 years is the time it takes light from the nearest star other than the Sun to reach Earth.

A4.text: Proxima Centauri, the nearest star to Earth after the Sun, is located 4.25 light-years (1.3 parsecs) away in the southern constellation of Centaurus.

A5.text: It would take 4.25 years for the information collected to be sent back to Earth.
